result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcahrge and all other applicable  costs and any other surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from Extended supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recomended treatment.

No contact with JLM, her immediate family, their residence or place(s) of employment.
No drugs.
Cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18.

Sex offender assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Take necessary medication.
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Comply with sex offender registry.
Pay supervision fees.
Alcohol and drug assessment.   Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until  civil rights are restored.  To provide DNA sampe and pay mandatory surcharge.
Pursuant to 973.048 defendant to complywith the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or particpate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre T Simpson-Lackey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (36 pages) commencing July 14, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 24 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 180 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 9 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assesment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex Offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*No contact with JLM, her immediate family, their residence or place(s) of employment
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*Take necessary medication
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.
*No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18
*Compy with Sex Offender Registry
*Pay supervision fees.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surchages.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release from extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC. 
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.

Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;  
jad

Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-14-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in court with attorney Christian T Eichenlaub.  Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 2:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in count 2 granted by the court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey not in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub in court, defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey not in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLM (DOB:  10/29/2001), SPR (DOB:  11/6/1997) and Tychena B.

Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Defendant Andre T Simpson-Lackey in custody.  Gale G Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
